trans-unit.source: Per-app VPN for Android using Pulse Secure | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Per-app VPN for Android using Pulse Secure | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: You can create a per-app VPN profile for Android devices managed by Intune.
trans-unit.target: You can create a per-app VPN profile for Android devices managed by Intune.

trans-unit.source: Use a custom policy to create a per-app VPN profile for Android devices
trans-unit.target: Use a custom policy to create a per-app VPN profile for Android devices

trans-unit.source: You can create a per-app VPN profile for Android 5.0 and later devices that are managed by Intune.
trans-unit.target: You can create a per-app VPN profile for Android 5.0 and later devices that are managed by Intune.

trans-unit.source: First, create a VPN profile that uses the Pulse Secure connection type.
trans-unit.target: First, create a VPN profile that uses the Pulse Secure connection type.

trans-unit.source: Then, create a custom configuration policy that associates the VPN profile with specific apps.
trans-unit.target: Then, create a custom configuration policy that associates the VPN profile with specific apps.

trans-unit.source: After you deploy the policy to your Android device or user groups, users should start the PulseSecure VPN.
trans-unit.target: After you deploy the policy to your Android device or user groups, users should start the PulseSecure VPN.

trans-unit.source: PulseSecure will then allow traffic only from the specified apps to use the open VPN connection.
trans-unit.target: PulseSecure will then allow traffic only from the specified apps to use the open VPN connection.

trans-unit.source: Only the Pulse Secure connection type is supported for this profile.
trans-unit.target: Only the Pulse Secure connection type is supported for this profile.

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Create a VPN profile
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Create a VPN profile

trans-unit.source: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Policy** > **Add Policy**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Policy** > **Add Policy**.

trans-unit.source: To select a template for the new policy, expand **Android**, and then choose **VPN Profile (Android 4 and later)**.
trans-unit.target: To select a template for the new policy, expand **Android**, and then choose **VPN Profile (Android 4 and later)**.

trans-unit.source: In the template, for **Connection type**, choose **Pulse Secure**.
trans-unit.target: In the template, for **Connection type**, choose **Pulse Secure**.

trans-unit.source: Finish and save the VPN profile.
trans-unit.target: Finish and save the VPN profile.

trans-unit.source: For more details about VPN profiles, see [VPN connections](../deploy-use/vpn-connections-in-microsoft-intune.md).
trans-unit.target: For more details about VPN profiles, see [VPN connections](../deploy-use/vpn-connections-in-microsoft-intune.md).

trans-unit.source: Take note of the VPN profile name to use in the next step.
trans-unit.target: Take note of the VPN profile name to use in the next step.

trans-unit.source: For example, MyAppVpnProfile.
trans-unit.target: For example, MyAppVpnProfile.

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Create a custom configuration policy
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Create a custom configuration policy

trans-unit.source: In the Intune admin console, choose **Policy** > **Add Policy** > **Android** > **Custom configuration** > **Create Policy**.
trans-unit.target: In the Intune admin console, choose **Policy** > **Add Policy** > **Android** > **Custom configuration** > **Create Policy**.

trans-unit.source: Enter a name for the policy.
trans-unit.target: Enter a name for the policy.

trans-unit.source: Under **OMA-URI settings**, choose **Add**.
trans-unit.target: Under **OMA-URI settings**, choose **Add**.

trans-unit.source: Enter a setting name.
trans-unit.target: Enter a setting name.

trans-unit.source: For **Data type**, specify **String**.
trans-unit.target: For **Data type**, specify **String**.

trans-unit.source: For **OMA-URI**, specify this string: **./Vendor/MSFT/VPN/Profile/*Name*/PackageList**, where *Name* is the VPN profile name you noted in Step 1.
trans-unit.target: For **OMA-URI**, specify this string: **./Vendor/MSFT/VPN/Profile/*Name*/PackageList**, where *Name* is the VPN profile name you noted in Step 1.

trans-unit.source: In our example, the string would be **./Vendor/MSFT/VPN/Profile/MyAppVpnProfile/PackageList**.
trans-unit.target: In our example, the string would be **./Vendor/MSFT/VPN/Profile/MyAppVpnProfile/PackageList**.

trans-unit.source: For **Value**, create a semicolon-separated list of packages to associate with the profile.
trans-unit.target: For **Value**, create a semicolon-separated list of packages to associate with the profile.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you want Excel and the Google Chrome browser to use the VPN connection, enter **com.microsoft.office.excel;com.android.chrome**.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you want Excel and the Google Chrome browser to use the VPN connection, enter **com.microsoft.office.excel;com.android.chrome**.

trans-unit.source: Example Android per-app VPN custom policy
trans-unit.target: Example Android per-app VPN custom policy

trans-unit.source: Set your app list to blacklist or whitelist (optional)
trans-unit.target: Set your app list to blacklist or whitelist (optional)

trans-unit.source: You can specify a list of apps that *cannot* use the VPN connection by using the **BLACKLIST** value.
trans-unit.target: You can specify a list of apps that *cannot* use the VPN connection by using the **BLACKLIST** value.

trans-unit.source: All other apps will connect through the VPN.
trans-unit.target: All other apps will connect through the VPN.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, you can use the **WHITELIST** value to specify a list of apps that *can* use the VPN connection.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, you can use the **WHITELIST** value to specify a list of apps that *can* use the VPN connection.

trans-unit.source: Apps that are not on the list will not connect through the VPN.
trans-unit.target: Apps that are not on the list will not connect through the VPN.

trans-unit.source: Under **OMA-URI** settings, choose **Add**.
trans-unit.target: Under **OMA-URI** settings, choose **Add**.

trans-unit.source: Enter a setting name.
trans-unit.target: Enter a setting name.

trans-unit.source: For **Data type**, specify **String**.
trans-unit.target: For **Data type**, specify **String**.

trans-unit.source: For **OMA-URI**, use this string: **./Vendor/MSFT/VPN/Profile/*Name*/Mode**, where *Name* is the VPN profile name you noted in Step 1.
trans-unit.target: For **OMA-URI**, use this string: **./Vendor/MSFT/VPN/Profile/*Name*/Mode**, where *Name* is the VPN profile name you noted in Step 1.

trans-unit.source: In our example, the string would be **./Vendor/MSFT/VPN/Profile/MyAppVpnProfile/Mode**.
trans-unit.target: In our example, the string would be **./Vendor/MSFT/VPN/Profile/MyAppVpnProfile/Mode**.

trans-unit.source: For **Value**, enter **BLACKLIST** or **WHITELIST**.
trans-unit.target: For **Value**, enter **BLACKLIST** or **WHITELIST**.

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Deploy both policies
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Deploy both policies

trans-unit.source: You must deploy *both* policies to the *same* Intune groups.
trans-unit.target: You must deploy *both* policies to the *same* Intune groups.

trans-unit.source: In the **Policy** workspace, select the policy that you want to deploy, and then choose **Manage Deployment**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Policy** workspace, select the policy that you want to deploy, and then choose **Manage Deployment**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Manage Deployment** dialog box:
trans-unit.target: In the **Manage Deployment** dialog box:

trans-unit.source: **To deploy the policy**, select one or more groups to deploy the policy to, then choose **Add** > **OK**.
trans-unit.target: **To deploy the policy**, select one or more groups to deploy the policy to, then choose **Add** > **OK**.

trans-unit.source: **To close the dialog box without deploying the policy**, choose **Cancel**.
trans-unit.target: **To close the dialog box without deploying the policy**, choose **Cancel**.

trans-unit.source: A status summary and alerts on the **Overview** page of the **Policy** workspace identify issues with the policy that require your attention.
trans-unit.target: A status summary and alerts on the **Overview** page of the **Policy** workspace identify issues with the policy that require your attention.

trans-unit.source: A status summary also appears in the **Dashboard** workspace.
trans-unit.target: A status summary also appears in the **Dashboard** workspace.
